newsitem.title: UK: Wassall sees 202 mln stg from GCC float.
newsitem.headline: Wassall sees 202 mln stg from GCC float.

text.p: British diversified industrial company Wassall Plc said on Friday that it expected to get net proceeds of about 202 million stg after the float of its General Cable Corporation unit in the U.S.
Wassall said GCC's initial public offering of 16.9 million shares have been priced at $21 per share.
The IPO, representing about 70 percent of GCC's issued share capital, is expected to be completed on May 20, 1997.
The aggregate proceeds to Wassall, including repayment of debt and payment of dividends to Wassall of 148 million stg, will total about 350 million stg.
The total proceeds, together with the value of 95 million stg attributable to the remaining stake at the IPO price, would give a total value of GCC to Wassall of about 445 million stg.
General Cable was bought in 1994 at a valuation of $150 million. Wassall is expected to return a substantial sum of money to shareholders out of the proceeds.
Wassall was marked up eight pence at 341 1/2p on Friday.
